title: Aikokusha
text:
The was a <a href="political%20party">political party</a> in <a href="Meiji%20period">Meiji-period</a> <a href="Japan">Japan</a>.
The Aikokusha was formed in February 1875 by <a href="Itagaki%20Taisuke">Itagaki Taisuke</a>, as part a <a href="Liberalism">liberal</a> political federation to associate his "<a href="Risshisha">Risshisha</a>" with the <a href="Freedom%20and%20People%27s%20Rights%20Movement">Freedom and People's Rights Movement</a>. It was disbanded the same year, when <a href="%C5%8Ckubo%20Toshimichi">Ōkubo Toshimichi</a> promised Itagaki that the government would draft a <a href="constitution">constitution</a>.
When no constitution had appeared by September 1878, Itagaki revived the "Aikokusha" and renamed it the <a href="League%20for%20the%20Establishment%20of%20a%20National%20Assembly">League for the Establishment of a National Assembly</a>. Its primary purpose was to petition the government to establish a <a href="Government%20of%20Meiji%20Japan%23Establishment%20of%20a%20national%20assembly">national assembly</a>. It was renamed <a href="Liberal%20Party%20of%20Japan%20%281881%29">Liberal Party</a>, which Itagaki founded in October 1881.
The "Aikokusha" should not be confused with the "<a href="Aikoku%20K%C5%8Dt%C5%8D">Aikoku Kōtō</a>", or with various later <a href="Uyoku%20dantai">ultranationalist</a> movements with similar names.
